discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A & B are correct.

comments.content: p196 forward of Study Guide. PSK would be in lieu of SN.

choices.B: The DHCP server that serves FortiGate is not configured with options 240 and 241.
choices.A: The serial number added on FortiManager does not match the FortiGate serial number.
choices.C: The pre-shared key set on FortiManager does not match the one set on FortiGate.
choices.D: Zero-touch provisioning is disabled on FortiManager.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is deploying a new FortiGate device using zero-touch provisioning. Before deployment, the administrator added the FortiGate serial number on FortiManager and configured all the FortiGate settings.

FortiGate has a factory default configuration. However, when the administrator connects FortiGate to the network, FortiManager does not start the installation automatically.

Which two scenarios are likely to cause this issue? (Choose two.)

Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


Examine the FortiSwitch security policy shown in the exhibit.

A device that does not support 802.1X authentication is connected to a port using the Port-Security security policy.

What action does the FortiSwitch take on the port?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I think it should be A

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct one.
" In case where a devices does not support 802.1X, you can configure the security profile to place that device in VLAN selected as Guest VLAN."

choices.A: FortiSwitch assigns the port to the onboarding VLAN.
choices.C: FortiSwitch assigns the port to the quarantine VLAN.
choices.D: FortiSwitch authenticates the device using the device MAC address as username and password.

ADE are the correct answers!! For sure you need to create PKI User

Selected Answer: BDE
Option A is false because creating a PKI user for the IPsec VPN user is not required, as the
user certificate can be verified by the CA certificate.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

Examine the IPsec VPN phase 1 configuration shown in the exhibit.
An administrator wants to use certificate-based authentication for an IPsec VPN user.
Which three configuration changes must you make on FortiGate to perform certificate-based authentication for the IPsec VPN user? (Choose three.)

choices.E: Enable XAUTH on the IPsec VPN tunnel.
choices.D: Import the CA that signed the user certificate.
choices.C: In the IKE section of the IPsec VPN tunnel, in the Mode field, select Main (ID protection).
choices.A: Create a PKI user for the IPsec VPN user, and then configure the IPsec VPN tunnel to accept the PKI user as peer certificate.
choices.B: In the Authentication section of the IPsec VPN tunnel, in the Method drop-down list, select Signature, and then select the certificate that FortiGate will use for IPsec VPN.

discussion.content: C - Max rec - Utilization is 75%, P444 Study guide

Selected Answer: C
C is correct answer as per study guide page 444

Selected Answer: D
D is correct as Good signal on a Fortigate -> Wifi clients is 65dBm

Which CLI command should an administrator use to view the certificate verification process in real time?
